_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Airgas East facility located in Dundalk MD, manufactures, packages and distributes

Propylene gas. Propylene is stored on site in quantities that exceed the Threshold Quantity for

Propylene. (Defined in Part 68.130 of the EPA Risk Management Program Rule)



The Worst Case release scenario for the Propylene process did not affect the public. There are no public

receptors within the distance to the end point from a worst case release scenario.The Propylene

manufacturing plant is EPA RMP Program level 1.



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies for the Dundalk site are

located in the Process Safety and Risk Management file. Airgas' Process Safety and Risk

Management Program provides instructions for implementing processes that produce employee

participation, RMP related deliverables, and training activities that are compliant with 40 CFR Part

68.



At the time this Executive Summary was written, the covered process had not been involved with an

accidental release that could have lead to property damage, catastrophic consequence, injury, or

death within the past 5 years. In addition, an accidental release had not lead to a response or

restoration activity for an exposure of an environmental receptor.



Employees of the Dundalk site will not respond to accidental releases of regulated substances.

The facility has an evacuation plan and has coordinated emergency response activities with

Dundalk, MD fire department.



The review of the Propylene PHA produced no recommendations to improve safety. At the time this

Executive Summary was written, there were no additional plans for improvement.
